Title: Drupal Core Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (SA-CORE-2020-012)
Consquence: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could affect Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability.
Diagnosis: Drupal is a free and open source content management framework written in PHP and distributed under the GNU General Public License. Drupal core does not properly sanitize certain filenames on uploaded files, which can lead to files being interpreted as the incorrect extension and served as the wrong MIME type or executed as PHP for certain hosting configurations. Affected Versions: Drupal 9.0, prior to Drupal 9.0.8 Drupal 8.9 prior to Drupal 8.9.9 Drupal 8.8, prior to Drupal 8.8.11 Drupal 7.x, prior to Drupal 7.74 QID Detection Logic:(Unauthenticated) This QID checks for vulnerable version of Drupal installed on the target.
Solution: Customers are advised to install latest drupal version. For more information visitDrupal security advisory SA-CORE-2020-012 Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  sa-core-2020-012

Title: Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS System proxy passwords may be logged in clear text vulnerability(PAN-140157)
Consquence: Successful exploitation could allow attacker to expose sensitive information.
Diagnosis: PAN OS is the software that runs all Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewalls. An information exposure through log file vulnerability where an administrator's password or other sensitive information may be logged in cleartext while using the CLI in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software. Affected Versions: PAN-OS 8.1 versions earlier than PAN-OS 8.1.17 PAN-OS 9.0 versions earlier than PAN-OS 9.0.11 PAN-OS 9.1 versions earlier than PAN-OS 9.1.2 QID Detection Logic (Authenticated): This QID looks for the vulnerable version of PAN-OS via XML API. NOTE: This issue is applicable only where either Captive Portal is enabled or Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is configured.
Solution: Refer to PAN-140157 for more information about patching this vulnerability.Workaround:This issue impacts the management web interface. You can mitigate the impact of this issue by following best practices for securing the interface. Please review the Best Practices for Securing Administrative Access in the PAN-OS technical documentation, available at https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/best-practices. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  PAN-140157

Title: Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS: Panorama session disclosure during context switch into managed device(PAN-125218)
Consquence: An information exposure vulnerability exists in Palo Alto Networks Panorama software that discloses the token for the Panorama web interface administrator's session to a managed device when the Panorama administrator performs a context switch into that device. This vulnerability allows an attacker to gain privileged access to the Panorama web interface. An attacker requires some knowledge of managed firewalls to exploit this issue.
Diagnosis: PAN OS is the software that runs all Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewalls. Affected Versions: PAN-OS 8.1 versions earlier than PAN-OS 8.1.17 PAN-OS 9.0 versions earlier than PAN-OS 9.0.11 PAN-OS 9.1 versions earlier than PAN-OS 9.1.5 QID Detection Logic (Authenticated): This QID looks for the vulnerable version of PAN-OS via XML API. NOTE: This issue is applicable only where either Captive Portal is enabled or Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) is configured.
Solution: Please protect your database users by choosing strong passwords, use logins different from system logins for the database, and restrict remote access to the database to a minimal level.Workaround:This issue can be completely mitigated by enabling custom certificate authentication between Panorama and managed firewalls. See https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/panorama/10-0/panorama-admin/set-up-panorama/set-up-authentication-using-custom-certificates.html This issue impacts the management web interface of appliances running PAN-OS software and is strongly mitigated by following best practices for securing the interface. Please review the Best Practices for Securing Administrative Access in the PAN-OS technical documentation, available at: https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/best-practices Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  PAN-125218

Title: Apache Tomcat Session Fixation Vulnerability
Consquence: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could affect Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability.
Diagnosis: Apache Tomcat is an open source web server and servlet container developed by the Apache Software Foundation. When using FORM authentication there was a narrow window where an attacker could perform a session fixation attack. The window was considered too narrow for an exploit to be practical but, erring on the side of caution, this issue has been treated as a security vulnerability. Affected Versions: Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.29 Apache Tomcat 8.5.0 to 8.5.49 Apache Tomcat 7.0.0 to 7.0.98 QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):  The QID checks if the target is running vulnerable version of Tomcat or not. QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):  The QID checks for vulnerable version by sending a GET /QUALYS91642 HTTP/1.0 request which helps in retrieving the installed version of Apache Tomcat in the banner of the response.
Solution: Upgrade to the Apache Tomcat 7.0.99,8.5.50, 9.0.30 or to the latest version of Apache Tomcat. Please refer to Apache Tomcat Website. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  Apache Tomcat

Title: Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS:Authentication bypass vulnerability in GlobalProtect SSL VPN client certificate verification(PAN-146650)
Consquence: An authentication bypass vulnerability exists in the GlobalProtect SSL VPN component of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software that allows an attacker to bypass all client certificate checks with an invalid certificate. A remote attacker can successfully authenticate as any user and gain access to restricted VPN network resources when the gateway or portal is configured to rely entirely on certificate-based authentication.
Diagnosis: PAN OS is the software that runs all Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewalls. An authentication bypass vulnerability exists in the GlobalProtect SSL VPN component of Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software that allows an attacker to bypass all client certificate checks with an invalid certificate. A remote attacker can successfully authenticate as any user and gain access to restricted VPN network resources when the gateway or portal is configured to rely entirely on certificate-based authentication. Impacted features that use SSL VPN with client certificate verification are: GlobalProtect Gateway, GlobalProtect Portal, GlobalProtect Clientless VPN Affected Versions: PAN-OS 8.1 versions earlier than PAN-OS 8.1.17; PAN-OS 9.0 versions earlier than PAN-OS 9.0.11; PAN-OS 9.1 versions earlier than PAN-OS 9.1.5; PAN-OS 10.0 versions earlier than PAN-OS 10.0.1. QID Detection Logic (Authenticated): This QID looks for the vulnerable version of PAN-OS via XML API.
Solution: Refer to PAN-146650 for more information about patching this vulnerability.Workaround:This issue can be mitigated by configuring GlobalProtect SSL VPN to require gateway and portal users to authenticate with their credentials. Other authentication methods are not impacted by this issue. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  PAN-146650

Title: ISC BIND Assertion Failure Vulnerability
Consquence: If nxdomain-redirect is enabled (via configuration) in a vulnerable BIND release, a malicious party can cause BIND to exit by deliberately triggering the bug.
Diagnosis: ISC BIND (Berkley Internet Domain Name) is an implementation of DNS protocols. In BIND Supported Preview Edition, an error in the nxdomain-redirect feature can occur in versions which support EDNS Client Subnet (ECS) features. In those versions which have ECS support, enabling nxdomain-redirect is likely to lead to BIND exiting due to assertion failure. Affected software: Bind 9.10.5-S1 -> 9.11.5-S5 QID Detection Logic: This unauthenticated check detects vulnerable systems by fetching the version information from the BIND service.
Solution: Customers are advised to upgrade to the patched release most closely related to your current version of BIND ISC BIND. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  cve-2019-6468

Title: Juniper Junos Privilege Escalation vulnerability(JSA10969)
Consquence: An attacker can exploit this issue and bypass restrictions via Clear Text Credentials of Junos OS.
Diagnosis: Juniper Junos is the network operating system used in Juniper Networks hardware systems. The vulnerability exists due to the affected software stores credentials used during device authentication unencrypted in its log file. A local authenticated user can obtain credentials. Affected releases are Junos OS: 15.1X49 versions prior to 15.1X49-D110 on vSRX, SRX1500, SRX4000 Series; 15.1X53 versions prior to 15.1X53-D234 on QFX5110, QFX5200 Series; 15.1X53 versions prior to 15.1X53-D68 on QFX10K Series; 17.1 versions prior to 17.1R2-S8, 17.1R3, on QFX5110, QFX5200, QFX10K Series; 17.2 versions prior to 17.2R1-S7, 17.2R2-S6, 17.2R3 on QFX5110, QFX5200, QFX10K Series; 17.3 versions prior to 17.3R2 on vSRX, SRX1500, SRX4000, QFX5110, QFX5200, QFX10K Series; 14.1X53 versions prior to 14.1X53-D47 on ACX5000, EX4600, QFX5100 Series; 15.1 versions prior to 15.1R7 on ACX5000, EX4600, QFX5100 Series; 16.1R7 versions prior to 16.1R7 on ACX5000, EX4600, QFX5100 Series; 17.1 versions prior to 17.1R2-S10, 17.1R3 on ACX5000, EX4600, QFX5100 Series; 17.2 versions prior to 17.2R3 on ACX5000, EX4600, QFX5100 Series; 17.3 versions prior to 17.3R3 on ACX5000, EX4600, QFX5100 Series; 17.4 versions prior to 17.4R2 on ACX5000, EX4600, QFX5100 Series; 18.1 versions prior to 18.1R2 on ACX5000, EX4600, QFX5100 Series; 15.1X53 versions prior to 15.1X53-D496 on NFX Series, 17.2 versions prior to 17.2R3-S1 on NFX Series; 17.3 versions prior to 17.3R3-S4 on NFX Series; 17.4 versions prior to 17.4R2-S4, 17.4R3 on NFX Series, 18.1 versions prior to 18.1R3-S4 on NFX Series; 18.2 versions prior to 18.2R2-S3, 18.2R3 on NFX Series; 18.3 versions prior to 18.3R1-S3, 18.3R2 on NFX Series; 18.4 versions prior to 18.4R1-S1, 18.4R2 on NFX Series. QID detection logic: (Authenticated) It checks for vulnerable Junos OS version.
Solution: The vendor has released fixes. For vSRX, SRX1500, SRX4000 Series, QFX5110, QFX5200, QFX10K Series: The following software releases have been updated to resolve this specific issue: 15.1X49-D110, 15.1X53-D234, 15.1X53-D68, 17.1R2-S8, 17.1R3, 17.2R1-S7, 17.2R2-S6, 17.2R3, 17.3R2, 17.4R1, and all subsequent releases. For ACX5000, EX4600 and QFX5100 Series: The following software releases have been updated to resolve this specific issue: 14.1X53-D47, 15.1R7, 16.1R7, 17.1R3, 17.2R3, 17.3R3, 17.4R2, 18.1R2, 18.2R1, and all subsequent releases. For NFX Series: The following software releases have been updated to resolve this specific issue: 15.1X53-D496, 17.2R3-S1, 17.3R3-S4, 17.4R3, 18.1R3-S4, 18.2R3, 18.3R2, 18.4R1-S1, 18.4R2, 19.1R1 and all subsequent releases. For more information please visit JSA10969. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  JSA10969

Title: Referrer-Policy HTTP Security Header Not Detected
Consquence: The Referrer-Policy header controls how much referrer information is sent to a site when navigating to it. Absence of Referrer-Policy header can lead to leakage of sensitive information via the referrer header.
Diagnosis: No Referrer Policy is specified for the link. It checks for one of the following Referrer Policy in the response headers: 1) no-referrer 2) no-referrer-when-downgrade 3) same-origin 4) origin 5) origin-when-cross-origin 6) strict-origin 7) strict-origin-when-cross-origin QID Detection Logic(Unauthenticated): If the Referrer Policy header is not found , checks in response body for meta tag containing tag name as "referrer" and one of the above Referrer Policy.
Solution: Referrer Policy header improves security by ensuring websites don't leak sensitive information via the referrer header. It's recommended to add secure Referrer Policies as a part of a defense-in-depth approach. References: - https://www.w3.org/TR/referrer-policy/ - https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Referrer-Policy

Title: rsyncd.conf configuration detected
Consquence: NA
Diagnosis: A local check is created to ensure the configuration limits access to only expected hosts by including allowed hosts in the Hosts Allow directive in the rsyncd.conf file. QID detection logic: Qid executes "cat /etc/rsyncd.conf | sed '/^#.*/d' | tr -d '\n' | tr '[' '\n' | grep -E "^(\w|\s)+]" |grep -v -E '(\w|\s)*].*(hosts allow)'" to detects the presence of and configuration of the rsyncd.conf file without "hosts allow" Note: This QID doesn't check if rsyncd service is running or not.
Solution: NA

Users of Tomcat 4.x should upgrade to Tomcat 7.x or later. The QID uses unzip command with -p (prints output to stdout) option to extract the version from catalina.jar file.

Title: NoSQL Injection - MongoDB
Consquence: MongoDB injection could allow attacker to manipulate the MondoDB query and get access to the entire data leading to data theft, manipulation or deletion of data.
Diagnosis: A MongoDB injection happens when user input is used in building MongoDB query without validation. This allows attacker to inject MongoDB commands that will be executed by the database engine.  Use of $where, mapReduce, $accumulator, $function operators in MongoDB query also opens possibility of query manipulation as well as executing arbitrary JavaScript code on the server if user input in used in these operators without proper sanitization.  NOTE: JavaScript injection in MongoDB query as well as other cases of Server-Side JavaScript code injection are covered in QID 150316  References: - https://zanon.io/posts/nosql-injection-in-mongodb - https://ckarande.gitbooks.io/owasp-nodegoat-tutorial/content/tutorial/a1_-_sql_and_nosql_injection.html - https://nullsweep.com/a-nosql-injection-primer-with-mongo/
Solution: Validate and sanitize user input before using in MongoDB queries. Pay special attention to usage of $where, mapReduce, $accumulator, $function clauses.  The following MongoDB operations permit users to run arbitrary JavaScript expressions directly on the server:  $where, mapReduce, $accumulator, $function $where is a popular clause, it let users specify a script to filter results.  Use of these operators in MongoDB query opens possibility of query manipulation as well as executing arbitrary JavaScript code on the server if user input in used in these operators without proper sanitization.  When unsanitized user controlled input is passed into a MongoDB query, they break the document query orientation structure and are sometimes executed as the JavaScript code itself.

Title: Server-Side JavaScript code injection
Consquence: Successful attack allows an attacker to run arbitrary JavaScript code on the server leading to serious consequences like data-theft, data manipulation and deletion, denial of service, manipulation of server data and configuration, file system access, malware implantation and  server compromise.
Diagnosis: Server side Java Script injection occurs when user controlled data is used on server side to construct dynamic scripts using various java script functions like eval(), SetTimeout(), setInterval, Function() without validation. Some databases, e.g. NoSQL databases like MongoDB, allow running JavaScript code as part of queries. An attacker can run arbitrary code if user controlled data is used in the queries (in clauses which allow JavaScript code). References: - https://ckarande.gitbooks.io/owasp-nodegoat-tutorial/content/tutorial/a1_-_server_side_js_injection.html - https://media.blackhat.com/bh-us-11/Sullivan/BH_US_11_Sullivan_Server_Side_WP.pdf
Solution: Avoid passing user controlled data to functions like eval(), setTimeout(), setInterval(), Function(). Validate and sanitize user input before using it in database queries and in server side processing.

Title: WordPress Loginizer plugin Unauthenticated SQL Injection and XSS Vulnerability
Consquence: Successful exploitation of the SQL injection vulnerability will allow Unauthenticated remote attacker to steal data from the Database and also possibly exfiltrate data to an attacker owned DNS. Also using the XSS vulnerability, it's possible for an attacker to steal the users cookie, allowing the session to be hijacked.
Diagnosis: WordPress Loginizer is a WordPress plugin that provides protection to fight against Login page based attacks on a WordPress. It also provides other features like Two Factor Auth, reCAPTCHA, PasswordLess Login etc. to improve security of your website. The plugin suffers from a Unauthenticated SQL Injection and a XSS vulnerability via IP HTTP Header. Affected Version: All versions prior to 1.6.4 QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated): The QID checks for the vulnerable version of Loginizer.
Solution: Customers are advised to upgrade to the fixed versions 1.6.4 or latest  Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  WordPress Plugin

Title: Oracle WebLogic Server Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Consquence: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the application. Also it's possible to issue system commands thereby compromising the target system.
Diagnosis: Oracle WebLogic Server (formerly known as BEA WebLogic Server) is an application server for building and deploying enterprise applications and services. A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Oracle WebLogic Server product of Oracle Fusion Middleware (component: Console). Affected Versions: Oracle WebLogic Server 10.3.6.0.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0 and 14.1.1.0.0 QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated): This QID sends a HTTP POST request, containing the payload which triggers a remote code execution on the application. On successful execution, a custom "X-Qualys-Weblogic" response header is added and detected in the response.
Solution: The vendor has released patches for these issues. Customers are advised to refer to Oracle CPUOCT2020 for detailed information. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  CPUOCT2020

Title: Apache "server-status" page exposed (mod_status)
Consquence: A malicious user can gain access to sensitive status information about your Apache web server. For example, a remote attacker can view all incoming requests, which may disclose hidden content or other sensitive information.
Diagnosis: The "server-status" page discloses sensitive information about the running instance of the Apache HTTP server. This page is enabled via the mod_status Apache module. QID detection logic: The scanner queries for the presence of the "/server-status" path on the server.
Solution: If you don't use this feature, you can choose to remove the mod_status Apache module from your httpd.conf file. Below is the configuration, which can be commented out:  <Location /server-status> SetHandler server-status Allow from all </Location>  Otherwise, restrict access to only the loopback IP address and/or administrator machines.

Title: VMware ESXi 7.0 Patch Release ESXi70U1b-17168206 Missing (VMSA-2020-0026)
Consquence: A malicious actor with local administrative privileges on a virtual machine may exploit this issue to execute code as the virtual machine's VMX process running on the host.
Diagnosis: VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product.  VMware ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion contain a use-after-free vulnerability in the XHCI USB controller.  Affected Versions: VMware ESXi 7.0 prior to build 17168206 QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated): This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi with build version using web service present on target. Note: Unable to check the workaround suggested by vendor in VMSA-2020-0026, hence added POTENTIAL CHECK.
Solution: Vmware has released patch for VMware ESXi 7.0 , visit VMware ESXi 7.0 Update 1b Refer to VMware advisory VMSA-2020-0026 for more information.Workaround:Remove a USB Controller from a Virtual Machine. Please visit here for more information. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  VMware ESXi 7.0 Update 1b

Title: Cisco Firepower Threat Defense Software Management Interface Denial of Service Vulnerability(cisco-sa-ftd-mgmt-interface-dos-FkG4MuTU)
Consquence:
A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause the remote management interface or Cisco Firepower Device Manager (FDM) to stop responding and cause other management functions to go offline, resulting in a DoS condition.
The user traffic that is flowing through the device would not be affected, and the DoS condition would be isolated to remote management only.
Diagnosis: A vulnerability in how Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software handles session timeouts for management connections could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a buildup of remote management connections to an affected device, which could result in a denial of service (DoS) condition. Affected Products: Cisco FTD Software releases earlier than Release 6.4.0.9 and Release 6.5.0.5. QID detection logic:The QID checks for Cisco FTD version retrieved via Unix Auth using "show version" command.
Solution: Customers are advised to refer to cisco-sa-ftd-mgmt-interface-dos-FkG4MuTU for more information. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  cisco-sa-ftd-mgmt-interface-dos-FkG4MuTU

Title: Cisco Firepower Threat Defense Software Generic Routing Encapsulation Tunnel IPv6 Denial of Service Vulnerability(cisco-sa-ftd-dos-2-sS2h7aWe)
Consquence: A successful exploit could allow the attacker to cause the device to crash, resulting in a DoS condition.
Diagnosis: A vulnerability in the generic routing encapsulation (GRE) tunnel decapsulation feature of Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. Affected Products Cisco FTD Software releases 6.3.0 and 6.4.0 Note: GRE tunnel decapsulation in the LINA engine was introduced in Cisco FTD Software Release 6.3.0. This feature is enabled by default and cannot be disabled. QID detection logic:The QID checks for Cisco FTD version retrieved via Unix Auth using "show version" command.
Solution: Customers are advised to refer to cisco-sa-ftd-dos-2-sS2h7aWe for more information. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  cisco-sa-ftd-dos-2-sS2h7aWe

Title: Cisco Firepower Threat Defense Software Shell Access Vulnerability(cisco-sa-ftd-shell-9rhJF68K)
Consquence: A successful exploit could allow the attacker to run any system command with root access on an affected device.
Diagnosis: A vulnerability in the support tunnel feature of Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to access the shell of an affected device even though expert mode is disabled. Affected Products Cisco FTD Software releases earlier than Release 6.5.0. QID detection logic:The QID checks for Cisco FTD version retrieved via Unix Auth using "show version" command.
Solution: Customers are advised to refer to cisco-sa-ftd-shell-9rhJF68K for more information. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  cisco-sa-ftd-shell-9rhJF68K

Title: Cisco Firepower Threat Defense Software Information Disclosure Vulnerability(cisco-sa-ftd-infodis-kZxGtUJD)
Consquence: A successful exploit could allow the attacker to gain unauthorized read access to sensitive data.
Diagnosis: A vulnerability in the application policy configuration of Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to gain unauthorized read access to sensitive data on an affected device. Affected Products: Cisco FTD Software releases earlier than releases 6.2.3.15, 6.3.0.5, and 6.4.0.6. QID detection logic:The QID checks for Cisco FTD version retrieved via Unix Auth using "show version" command.
Solution: Customers are advised to refer to cisco-sa-ftd-infodis-kZxGtUJD for more information. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  cisco-sa-ftd-infodis-kZxGtUJD

Title: Cisco Webex Network Recording Player and Cisco Webex Player Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerabilities(cisco-sa-webex-nbr-NOS6FQ24)
Consquence: A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected system with the privileges of the targeted user.
Diagnosis: Multiple vulnerabilities in Cisco Webex Network Recording Player for Windows and Cisco Webex Player for Windows could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on an affected system. Affected Products: Cisco Webex Network Recording Player for Windows and Cisco Webex Player for Windows, which are available from Cisco Webex Meetings: Cisco Webex Meetings: All Webex Network Recording Player and Webex Player releases earlier than the first fixed releases. From 40.6.0 prior to 40.6.11 From 40.7.0 prior to 40.8.0 QID Detection Logic (Authenticated): The check matches for Cisco Webex Network Recording Player file version by reading the contents of "builder.ini" file on the target.
Solution: Customers are advised to refer to cisco-sa-webex-nbr-NOS6FQ24 for more information. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  cisco-sa-webex-nbr-NOS6FQ24

Title: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerability(cisco-sa-anyconnect-ipc-KfQO9QhK)
Consquence:
A successful exploit could allow an attacker to cause the targeted AnyConnect user to execute a script.
This script would execute with the privileges of the targeted AnyConnect user.
Diagnosis: A vulnerability in the interprocess communication (IPC) channel of Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to cause a targeted AnyConnect user to execute a malicious script. Affected Versions: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Software for the following platforms if they have Bypass Downloader set to its default value of false: AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for Windows,Linux,MAC QID Detection Logic (Authenticated): This checks for vulnerable version of AnyConnect.
Solution: Customers are advised to refer to cisco-sa-anyconnect-ipc-KfQO9QhK for more information.

Title: Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software Privilege Escalation Vulnerability(cisco-sa-vmanage-escalation-Jhqs5Skf)
Consquence:
A successful exploit could allow the attacker to overwrite arbitrary files, allowing the attacker to
modify the system in such a way that could allow the attacker to gain escalated privileges.
Diagnosis: A vulnerability in system file transfer functions of Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to gain escalated privileges on the underlying operating system. Affected Products Cisco devices if they are running a vulnerable release of Cisco SD-WAN vManage Software. QID detection logic:The QID checks for Cisco SD WAN version retrieved via Unix Auth using "show system status" command.
Solution: Customers are advised to refer to cisco-sa-vmanage-escalation-Jhqs5Skf for more information. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  cisco-sa-vmanage-escalation-Jhqs5Skf

Title: Cisco IOS XR Software Enhanced Preboot eXecution Environment Unsigned Code Execution Vulnerability(cisco-sa-iosxr-pxe-unsign-code-exec-qAa78fD2#fs)
Consquence: A successful exploit could allow the attacker to execute unsigned code on the affected device.
Diagnosis: A vulnerability in the enhanced Preboot eXecution Environment (PXE) boot loader for Cisco IOS XR 64-bit Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to execute unsigned code during the PXE boot process on an affected device. Affected Products Cisco devices if they are running a vulnerable release of Cisco IOS XR 64-bit Software and the following conditions are met: i.The product ID (PID) of the device matches one of the vulnerable PIDs. ii.The device is running a vulnerable BIOS version. iii.The device uses PXE for network boot. Note: Since detection is not checking whether device uses PXE for network boot, QID is marked potential. QID Detection Logic (Authenticated): The check matches Cisco IOS XR version retrieved via Unix Auth using "show version" command.
Solution: Customers are advised to refer to cisco-sa-iosxr-pxe-unsign-code-exec-qAa78fD2#fs for more information. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  cisco-sa-iosxr-pxe-unsign-code-exec-qAa78fD2#fs

Title: Cisco IOS XR Software for Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers Slow Path Forwarding Denial of Service Vulnerability(cisco-sa-xr-cp-dos-ej8VB9QY)
Consquence: A successful exploit could cause the affected device to run out of buffer resources, which could make the device unable to process or forward traffic, resulting in a DoS condition. The device would need to be restarted to regain functionality.
Diagnosis: A vulnerability in the ingress packet processing function of Cisco IOS XR Software for Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. Affected Products Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers if they are running a Cisco IOS XR Software releases: i. Title: IBM AIX Vulnerabilities in NTP (ntp_advisory13)
Consquence: A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to affect confidentiality, integrity and availability.

Title: Amazon Linux Security Advisory for webkitgtk4: ALAS2-2020-1563
Consquence: Allows unauthorized disclosure of information; allows unauthorized modification; allows disruption of service.
Diagnosis:
<DIV> Issue Overview: 
WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit prior to version 2.24.1 failed to properly apply configured HTTP proxy settings when downloading livestream video (HLS, DASH, or Smooth Streaming), an error resulting in deanonymization. This issue was corrected by changing the way livestreams are downloaded. (CVE-2019-11070 )
Multiple memory corruption issues were addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.3, macOS Mojave 10.14.5, tvOS 12.3, Safari 12.1.1, iTunes for Windows 12.9.5, iCloud for Windows 7.12. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. (CVE-2019-6237 )
WebKitGTK and WPE WebKit prior to version 2.24.1 are vulnerable to address bar spoofing upon certain JavaScript redirections. An attacker could cause malicious web content to be displayed as if for a trusted URI. This is similar to the CVE-2018-8383  issue in Microsoft Edge. (CVE-2019-6251 )
A type confusion issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.2, tvOS 12.2, watchOS 5.2, Safari 12.1, iTunes 12.9.4 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 7.11. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. (CVE-2019-8506 )
Multiple memory corruption issues were addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.2, tvOS 12.2, Safari 12.1, iTunes 12.9.4 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 7.11. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. (CVE-2019-8524 )
A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.2, tvOS 12.2, Safari 12.1, iTunes 12.9.4 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 7.11. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. (CVE-2019-8535 )
A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.2, tvOS 12.2, watchOS 5.2, Safari 12.1, iTunes 12.9.4 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 7.11. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. (CVE-2019-8536 )
A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.2, tvOS 12.2, watchOS 5.2, Safari 12.1, iTunes 12.9.4 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 7.11. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. (CVE-2019-8544 )
A logic issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.2, tvOS 12.2, Safari 12.1, iTunes 12.9.4 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 7.11. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to universal cross site scripting. (CVE-2019-8551 )
Multiple memory corruption issues were addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.2, tvOS 12.2, watchOS 5.2, Safari 12.1, iTunes 12.9.4 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 7.11. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. (CVE-2019-8558 )</DIV>

Title: Amazon Linux Security Advisory for nspr: ALAS2-2020-1559
Consquence: Allows unauthorized disclosure of information; allows unauthorized modification; allows disruption of service.
Diagnosis:
<DIV> Issue Overview: 
When importing a curve25519 private key in PKCS#8format with leading 0x00 bytes, it is possible to trigger an out-of-bounds read in the Network Security Services (NSS) library. This could lead to information disclosure. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, and Thunderbird < 60.8. (CVE-2019-11719 )
A vulnerability exists where it possible to force Network Security Services (NSS) to sign CertificateVerify with PKCS#1 v1.5 signatures when those are the only ones advertised by server in CertificateRequest in TLS 1.3. PKCS#1 v1.5 signatures should not be used for TLS 1.3 messages. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 68. (CVE-2019-11727 )
A use-after-free flaw was found in Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS) related to PK11 session handling. An attacker could use this flaw to execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the application compiled with NSS. (CVE-2019-11756 )
A vulnerability was discovered in nss where input text length was not checked when using certain cryptographic primitives. This could lead to a heap-buffer overflow resulting in a crash and data leak. The highest threat is to confidentiality and integrity of data as well as system availability. (CVE-2019-17006 )
A protocol downgrade flaw was found in Network Security Services (NSS). After a HelloRetryRequest has been sent, the client may negotiate a lower protocol than TLS 1.3, resulting in an invalid state transition in the TLS State Machine. If the client gets into this state, incoming Application Data records will be ignored. (CVE-2019-17023 )
A side channel flaw was found in nss, in the way P-384 and P-521 curves are used in the generation of EDSA signatures, leaking partial information about the ECDSA nonce. Given a small number of ECDSA signatures, this information can be used to steal the private key. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality. (CVE-2020-12400 )
A flaw was found in nss. Using the EM side-channel, it is possible to extract the position of zero and non-zero wNAF digits while nss-certutil tool performs scalar multiplication during the ECDSA signature generation, leaking partial information about the ECDSA nonce. Given a small number of ECDSA signatures, this information can be used to steal the private key. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality. (CVE-2020-12401 )
A flaw was found in NSS, where it is vulnerable to RSA key generation cache timing side-channel attacks. An attacker with sufficient access to mount cache timing attacks during the RSA key generation process could recover the private key. The highest threat to this flaw is to confidentiality. (CVE-2020-12402 )
A flaw was found in the way CHACHA20-POLY1305 was implemented in NSS. When using multi-part Chacha20, it could cause out-of-bounds reads. This issue was fixed by explicitly disabling multi-part ChaCha20 (which was not functioning correctly) and strictly enforcing tag length. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality and system availability. (</DIV>
Solution: Please refer to Amazon advisory ALAS-2020-1559 for affected packages and patching details, or update with your package manager. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  ALAS-2020-1559: Amazon Linux 2 (nspr (3.53.1-3.amzn2) on x86_64) ALAS-2020-1559: Amazon Linux 2 (nspr (3.53.1-3.amzn2) on aarch64) ALAS-2020-1559: Amazon Linux 2 (nspr (3.53.1-3.amzn2) on src) ALAS-2020-1559: Amazon Linux 2 (nspr (3.53.1-3.amzn2) on i686)

In libvpx, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. Product: AndroidVersions: Android-10Android ID: A-122675483 (CVE-2019-9232 )
In libvpx, there is a possible information disclosure due to improper input validation. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation. Product: AndroidVersions: Android-10Android ID: A-80479354 (CVE-2019-9433 )
In vp8_decode_frame of decodeframe.c, there is a possible out of bounds read due to improper input validation. This could lead to remote information disclosure if error correction were turned on, with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-8.0 Android-8.1Android ID: A-62458770 (CVE-2020-0034 ) </DIV>

Title: Amazon Linux Security Advisory for kernel: ALAS2-2020-1556
Consquence: Allows unauthorized disclosure of information; allows unauthorized modification; allows disruption of service.
Diagnosis:
<DIV> Issue Overview: 
In binder_release_work of binder.c, there is a possible use-after-free due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in the kernel with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.. (CVE-2020-0423 ) Issue Overview: 
A flaw was found in the way the Linux kernel's Bluetooth implementation handled L2CAP (Logical Link Control and Adaptation Protocol) packets with A2MP (Alternate MAC-PHY Manager Protocol) CID (Channel Identifier). This flaw allows a remote attacker in an adjacent range to crash the system, causing a denial of service or potentially executing arbitrary code on the system by sending a specially crafted L2CAP packet. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability. (CVE-2020-12351 ) Issue Overview: 
An information leak flaw was found in the way Linux kernel's Bluetooth stack implementation handled initialization of stack memory when handling certain AMP (Alternate MAC-PHY Manager Protocol) packets. This flaw allows a remote attacker in an adjacent range to leak small portions of stack memory on the system by sending specially crafted AMP packets. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality. (CVE-2020-12352 ) Issue Overview: 
A heap buffer overflow flaw was found in the way the Linux kernel's Bluetooth implementation processed extended advertising report events. This flaw allows a remote attacker in an adjacent range to crash the system, causing a denial of service or to potentially execute arbitrary code on the system by sending a specially crafted Bluetooth packet. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability. (CVE-2020-24490 ) Issue Overview: 
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. A local attacker, able to inject conntrack netlink configuration, could overflow a local buffer causing crashes or triggering the use of incorrect protocol numbers in ctnetlink_parse_tuple_filter in net/netfilter/nf_conntrack_netlink.c. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability. (CVE-2020-25211 ) </DIV>
Solution: Please refer to Amazon advisory ALAS-2020-1556 for affected packages and patching details, or update with your package manager. Title: Amazon Linux Security Advisory for qemu-kvm: ALAS-2020-1449
Consquence: Allows unauthorized disclosure of information; allows unauthorized modification; allows disruption of service.
Diagnosis:
<DIV> Issue Overview: 
qemu-seccomp.c in QEMU might allow local OS guest users to cause a denial of service (guest crash) by leveraging mishandling of the seccomp policy for threads other than the main thread. (CVE-2018-15746 )
A heap buffer overflow issue was found in the SLiRP networking implementation of the QEMU emulator. This flaw occurs in the ip_reass() routine while reassembling incoming packets if the first fragment is bigger than the m->m_dat[] buffer. An attacker could use this flaw to crash the QEMU process on the host, resulting in a Denial of Service or potentially executing arbitrary code with privileges of the QEMU process. (CVE-2019-14378 )
An out-of-bounds read/write access flaw was found in the USB emulator of the QEMU. This issue occurs while processing USB packets from a guest when USBDevice 'setup_len' exceeds its 'data_buf[4096]' in the do_token_in, do_token_out routines. This flaw allows a guest user to crash the QEMU process, resulting in a denial of service, or the potential execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the QEMU process on the host. (CVE-2020-14364 )
A use-after-free flaw was found in the SLiRP networking implementation of the QEMU emulator. Specifically, this flaw occurs in the ip_reass() routine while reassembling incoming IP fragments whose combined size is bigger than 65k. This flaw allows an attacker to crash the QEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2020-1983 ) </DIV>
Solution: Please refer to Amazon advisory ALAS-2020-1449 for affected packages and patching details, or update with your package manager. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  ALAS-2020-1449: Amazon Linux (qemu-kvm (1.5.3-156.24.amzn1) on src) ALAS-2020-1449: Amazon Linux (qemu-kvm (1.5.3-156.24.amzn1) on x86_64)

Title: Amazon Linux Security Advisory for ruby24: ALAS-2020-1451
Consquence: Allows unauthorized disclosure of information; allows unauthorized modification; allows disruption of service.
Diagnosis:
<DIV> Issue Overview: 
An issue was discovered in Ruby through 2.5.8, 2.6.x through 2.6.6, and 2.7.x through 2.7.1. WEBrick, a simple HTTP server bundled with Ruby, had not checked the transfer-encoding header value rigorously. An attacker may potentially exploit this issue to bypass a reverse proxy (which also has a poor header check), which may lead to an HTTP Request Smuggling attack. (CVE-2020-25613 ) </DIV>

Title: Amazon Linux Security Advisory for squid: ALAS-2020-1453
Consquence: Allows unauthorized disclosure of information; allows unauthorized modification; allows disruption of service.
Diagnosis:
<DIV> Issue Overview: 
An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.10. It allows a crafted FTP server to trigger disclosure of sensitive information from heap memory, such as information associated with other users' sessions or non-Squid processes. (CVE-2019-12528 )
An issue was discovered in http/ContentLengthInterpreter.cc in Squid before 4.12 and 5.x before 5.0.3. A Request Smuggling and Poisoning attack can succeed against the HTTP cache. The client sends an HTTP request with a Content-Length header containing "+\ "-" or an uncommon shell whitespace character prefix to the length field-value. (CVE-2020-15049 )
A flaw was found in squid. Due to incorrect data validation, a HTTP Request Smuggling attack against HTTP and HTTPS traffic is possible leading to cache poisoning. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity. (CVE-2020-15810 )
A flaw was found in squid. Due to incorrect data validation, an HTTP Request Splitting attack against HTTP and HTTPS traffic is possible leading to cache poisoning. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity. (CVE-2020-15811 )
Squid before 4.13 and 5.x before 5.0.4 allows a trusted peer to perform Denial of Service by consuming all available CPU cycles during handling of a crafted Cache Digest response message. This only occurs when cache_peer is used with the cache digests feature. The problem exists because peerDigestHandleReply() livelocking in peer_digest.cc mishandles EOF. (CVE-2020-24606 )
An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.10. Due to incorrect input validation, it can interpret crafted HTTP requests in unexpected ways to access server resources prohibited by earlier security filters. (CVE-2020-8449 )
An issue was discovered in Squid before 4.10. Due to incorrect buffer management, a remote client can cause a buffer overflow in a Squid instance acting as a reverse proxy. (CVE-2020-8450 ) </DIV>
Solution: Please refer to Amazon advisory ALAS-2020-1453 for affected packages and patching details, or update with your package manager. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  ALAS-2020-1453: Amazon Linux (squid (3.5.20-17.41.amzn1) on x86_64) ALAS-2020-1453: Amazon Linux (squid (3.5.20-17.41.amzn1) on i686) ALAS-2020-1453: Amazon Linux (squid (3.5.20-17.41.amzn1) on src)

Title: Amazon Linux Security Advisory for samba: ALAS-2020-1452
Consquence: Allows unauthorized disclosure of information; allows unauthorized modification; allows disruption of service.
Diagnosis:
<DIV> Issue Overview: 
All samba versions 4.9.x before 4.9.18, 4.10.x before 4.10.12 and 4.11.x before 4.11.5 have an issue where if it is set with "log level = 3" (or above) then the string obtained from the client, after a failed character conversion, is printed. Such strings can be provided during the NTLMSSP authentication exchange. In the Samba AD DC in particular, this may cause a long-lived process(such as the RPC server) to terminate. (In the file server case, the most likely target, smbd, operates as process-per-client and so a crash there is harmless). (CVE-2019-14907 ) </DIV>
Solution: Please refer to Amazon advisory ALAS-2020-1452 for affected packages and patching details, or update with your package manager. Title: Amazon Linux Security Advisory for kernel: ALAS-2020-1446
Consquence: Allows unauthorized disclosure of information; allows unauthorized modification; allows disruption of service.
Diagnosis:
<DIV> Issue Overview: 
In binder_release_work of binder.c, there is a possible use-after-free due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in the kernel with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation. (CVE-2020-0423 ) 
A flaw was found in the way the Linux kernel's Bluetooth implementation handled L2CAP (Logical Link Control and Adaptation Protocol) packets with A2MP (Alternate MAC-PHY Manager Protocol) CID (Channel Identifier). This flaw allows a remote attacker in an adjacent range to crash the system, causing a denial of service or potentially executing arbitrary code on the system by sending a specially crafted L2CAP packet. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability. (CVE-2020-12351 ) 
An information leak flaw was found in the way Linux kernel's Bluetooth stack implementation handled initialization of stack memory when handling certain AMP (Alternate MAC-PHY Manager Protocol) packets. This flaw allows a remote attacker in an adjacent range to leak small portions of stack memory on the system by sending specially crafted AMP packets. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality. (CVE-2020-12352 ) 
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. Memory corruption can be exploited to gain root privileges from unprivileged processes. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability. (CVE-2020-14386 ) 
A heap buffer overflow flaw was found in the way the Linux kernel's Bluetooth implementation processed extended advertising report events. This flaw allows a remote attacker in an adjacent range to crash the system, causing a denial of service or to potentially execute arbitrary code on the system by sending a specially crafted Bluetooth packet. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability. (CVE-2020-24490 ) 
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. A local attacker, able to inject conntrack netlink configuration, could overflow a local buffer causing crashes or triggering the use of incorrect protocol numbers in ctnetlink_parse_tuple_filter in net/netfilter/nf_conntrack_netlink.c. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability. (CVE-2020-25211 ) </DIV>
Solution: Please refer to Amazon advisory ALAS-2020-1446 for affected packages and patching details, or update with your package manager. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  ALAS-2020-1446: Amazon Linux (kernel (4.14.203-116.332.amzn1) on x86_64) ALAS-2020-1446: Amazon Linux (kernel (4.14.203-116.332.amzn1) on i686) ALAS-2020-1446: Amazon Linux (kernel (4.14.203-116.332.amzn1) on src)

Title: SQLite resetAccumulator and Heap Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
Consquence: Successful exploitation allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the targeted system.
Diagnosis: SQLite is a popular library implementing a SQL database engine. It is used extensively in mobile devices, browsers, hardware devices, and user applications. It is a frequent choice for a small, fast, and reliable database solution. An exploitable use after-free in resetAccumulator in select.c because the parse tree rewrite for window functions is too late and leading to a multiSelectOrderBy heap overflow because of misuse of transitive properties. Affected Version:  Sqlite 3.32.2 QID Detection Logic: This QID checks for the vulnerable versions.

Title: Zoho ManageEngine Password Manager Pro 9 Reflected XSS Vulnerability
Consquence: A successful attack could run a malicious script or piece of code is reflected off of a web application to the victim's browser and gain unauthorized access to attacker.
Diagnosis: Password Manager Pro is a password management solution by ManageEngine. ManageEngine Password Manager Pro is vulnerable to Reflected XSS attacks Affected Versions: Zoho ManageEngine Password Manager Pro before 9.4  QID Detection logic: The qid checks the version before 9.4 (9400).
Solution: Latest version can be downloaded at ManageEngine Password Manager Pro.  Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  ManageEngine Password Manager Pro

Title: IBM Installation Manager Unauthorized Access Vulnerability
Consquence: Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of Java SE, Java SE Embedded accessible data as well as unauthorized read access to a subset of Java SE, Java SE Embedded accessible data.
Diagnosis: IBM Installation Manager is an application that is used for downloading and installing trial code for many IBM software products There is a vulnerability in IBM Runtime Environment Java Version 8 used by IBM Installation Manager. An unspecified vulnerability in Java SE related to the Java SE Lightweight HTTP Server component could allow an unauthenticated attacker to cause low confidentiality impact, low integrity impact, and no availability impact. Affected Products: IBM Installation Manger 1.9.x
Solution: Customers are advised to refer to 6260897 for information pertaining to remediating this vulnerability. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  6260897

Title: Wireshark Multiple Vulnerabilities (wnpa-sec-2020-14 and wnpa-sec-2020-15)
Consquence: It may be possible to make Wireshark consume excessive CPU resources by injecting a malformed packet onto the wire or by convincing someone to read a malformed packet trace file.
Diagnosis: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer available for multiple operating systems. It lets you capture and interactively browse the traffic running on a computer network. The GQUIC dissector could crash. Facebook Zero Protocol (aka FBZERO) dissector could enter an infinite loop. Affected version: Wireshark Version: 3.2.0 to 3.2.7 QID Detection Logic (Authenticated): Windows: wireshark.exe file version is checked, MAC OSX: Wireshark app version is checked.
Solution: The vendor has released patch in Wireshark versions 3.4.0, 3.2.8 or later.. addressing these vulnerability. The latest version of the product is available for download from Wireshark Official site The latest version of the product is available for download from Wireshark Official site Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  wnpa-sec-2020-15 wnpa-sec-2020-14

Title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Network Deployment XSS Vulnerability(6323293)
Consquence: An attacker could exploit this vulnerability which can impact integrity and confidentiality of the target.
Diagnosis: IBM WebSphere Application Server ND is vulnerable to cross-site scripting when High Availability Deployment Manager is configured. Affected Versions: IBM WebSphere Application Server ND V9.0.0.0 through 9.0.5.4 IBM WebSphere Application Server ND V8.5.0.0 through 8.5.5.17  QID Detection Logic (Authenticated): This QID checks for the vulnerable version of IBM WebSphere Application Server and checks if the patches (PH26761) are installed or not. QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated): This QID matches vulnerable versions via the GIOP banner.
Solution: The vendor has released patches. Please visit IBM WebSphere Application Server ND for more information. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  IBM WebSphere Application Server ND

Title: OpenLDAP NULL Pointer Dereference Vulnerability
Consquence: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could affect Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability.
Diagnosis: LDAP stands for Lightweight Directory Access Protocol. It is a lightweight protocol for accessing directory services. A directory is a specialized database optimized for reading, browsing and searching.  OpenLDAP slapd crashes on what seems to be a null-ptr-dereference after receiving a malicious TCP packet. Affected Versions: OpenLDAP versions prior to 2.4.55 QID Detection Logic (Authenticated): The check matches Open LDAP version retrieved using "/usr/sbin/slapd -VV" command.
Solution: Customers are advised to refer to OpenLDAP for more information. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  OpenLDAP

Title: SaltStack Salt Multiple Security Vulnerabilities
Consquence: Depending on the vulnerability being exploited, a remote attacker could conduct directory traversal attacks or execute arbitrary command on the targeted system.
Diagnosis: SaltStack Salt is a software to automate the management and configuration of any infrastructure or application at scale. SaltStack Salt contains the following vulnerabilities: CVE-2020-16846: Prevent shell injections in netapi ssh client  CVE-2020-17490: Prevent creating world readable private keys with the tls execution module.SALT 2019.2.6. Affected Versions: SaltStack Salt versions prior to SALT 3001.2 SaltStack Salt versions prior to SALT 3000.4 SaltStack Salt 3002 SaltStack Salt versions prior to SALT 2019.2.6 Note: Previous versions are also affected. QID Detection Logic: This authenticated QID detects vulnerable salt-master versions by running the following command: salt-master --versions-report
VendorReferenceId:
[
  "SALT 3001.2 RELEASE NOTES",
  "SALT 3000.4 RELEASE NOTES",
  "SALT 2019.2.6 RELEASE NOTES",

Title: SaltStack Salt API Authentication Bypass Vulnerability (CVE-2020-25592)
Consquence: Successful exploitation allows attacker to execute remote code and compromise the system.
Diagnosis: SaltStack Salt is a software to automate the management and configuration of any infrastructure or application at scale. SaltStack Salt contains the following vulnerability: CVE-2020-25592: eauth was not properly validated when calling Salt SSH via the salt-api. Affected Versions: SaltStack Salt versions prior to SALT 3001.3 SaltStack Salt 3002 SaltStack Salt versions prior to SALT 3000.5 SaltStack Salt versions prior to SALT 2019.2.7 Note: Previous versions are also affected. QID Detection Logic: This authenticated QID detects vulnerable salt-master versions by running the following command: salt-master --versions-report
VendorReferenceId:
[
  "SALT 2019.2.7 RELEASE NOTES",
  "SALT 3000.5 RELEASE NOTES",
  "SALT 3001.3 RELEASE NOTES",
  "SALT 3002.1 RELEASE NOTES"
]
Solution: Customers are advised to upgrade to Salt versions 3001.3 2019.2.7, 3002.1 or 3000.5 to remediate these vulnerabilities. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  SaltStack Package Repo

Title: Microsoft Edge Based On Chromium Prior to 86.0.622.63 Multiple Vulnerabilities (ADV200002)
Consquence: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability affects confidentiality,integrity and availability.
Diagnosis: Microsoft Edge based on Chromium is affected by the following vulnerabilities: Affected Version:Microsoft Edge based on Chromium Prior to version 86.0.622.63 QID Detection Logic: (authenticated)Operating System: WindowsThe install path is checked via registry "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Clients\StartMenuInternet\Microsoft Edge\shell\open\command". The version is checked via file msedge.exe. QID Detection Logic: (authenticated)Operating System: MacOSThe QID checks for vulnerable version of Microsoft Edge from installed application list.
Solution: Customers are advised to upgrade to version 86.0.622.63 or later  For further details refer to ADV200002 Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  ADV200002

Title: Adobe Security Update for Adobe Acrobat and Reader(APSB20-67)
Consquence: An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to compromise Confidentiality, Integrity and/or Availability.
Diagnosis: Adobe Reader and Acrobat are applications for handling PDF files. Adobe Reader and Acrobat are prone to multiple vulnerabilities that could potentially allow an attacker to take control of an affected system. Affected Versions: Acrobat DC Continuous versions prior to 2020.013.20064 for Windows and Macintosh Acrobat Reader DC Continuous versions prior to 2020.013.20064 for Windows and Macintosh Acrobat Classic 2020 version prior to 2020.001.30010  Acrobat Reader Classic 2020 version prior to 2020.001.30010 Acrobat 2017 versions prior to 2017.011.30180 for Windows and Macintosh Acrobat Reader 2017 versions prior to 2017.011.30180 for Windows and Macintosh QID Detection Logic (Authenticated): This QID looks for the vulnerable version of Acrobat.dll, AcroRd32.dll and nppdf32.dll files.
Solution: Adobe has released fix to address this issue. Customers are advised to refer to APSB20-67 for updates pertaining to this vulnerability. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  APSB20-67

Title: Git for Windows Large File Storage Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Consquence: Successful exploitation allows attacker to execute remote code and compromise the system.
Diagnosis: Git is a revision control system, a tool to manage your source code history. On Windows, if Git LFS operates on a malicious repository with a git.bat or git.exe file in the current directory, that program is executed, permitting the attacker to execute arbitrary code. This security problem does not affect Unix systems. Affected Versions: Git for Windows prior to 2.29.2.2
Solution: Customers are advised to upgrade to Git for Windows 2.29.2.2  or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  Git for Windows 2.29.2.2: WIndows (Git)

Title: F5 BIG-IP ASM,LTM,APM Linux Kernel Vulnerability(K04107324)
Consquence: An attacker may cause a denial-of-service (DoS) that results in a traffic disruption.
Diagnosis: F5 BIG-IP ASM (Application Security Manager) is a flexible web application firewall that secures web applications in traditional, virtual, and private cloud environments. F5 BIG-IP (LTM) Local Traffic Manager is the most popular module offered on F5 Networks BiG-IP platform. The real power of the LTM is it is a Full Proxy, allowing you to augment client and server side connections. All while making informed load balancing decisions on availability, performance, and persistence. F5 BIG-IP Access Policy Manager (APM) is a secure, flexible, high-performance solution that provides unified global access to your network, cloud, and applications. Vulnerable Component: BIG-IP ASM, APM,LTM Affected Versions: 16.0.0  15.1.0 - 15.1.1  14.1.0 - 14.1.2  13.1.0 - 13.1.3  12.1.0 - 12.1.5  11.6.1 - 11.6.5  QID Detection Logic(Authenticated): This QID checks for the vulnerable versions of F5 BIG-IP devices using the tmsh command.
Solution: The vendor has released any patch, for more information please visit: K04107324 Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  K04107324

Title: F5 BIG-IP ASM,LTM,APM TMUI vulnerability(K43310520)
Consquence: An authenticated attacker may be able to store JavaScript, which is executed when another authenticated user accesses the Configuration utility. If the victim is an administrator user with Advanced Shell (bash) access, an attacker can use Remote Code Execution to leverage a successful exploit of this vulnerability into a complete compromise of the BIG-IP system.
Diagnosis: F5 BIG-IP ASM (Application Security Manager) is a flexible web application firewall that secures web applications in traditional, virtual, and private cloud environments. F5 BIG-IP (LTM) Local Traffic Manager is the most popular module offered on F5 Networks BiG-IP platform. The real power of the LTM is it is a Full Proxy, allowing you to augment client and server side connections. All while making informed load balancing decisions on availability, performance, and persistence. F5 BIG-IP Access Policy Manager (APM) is a secure, flexible, high-performance solution that provides unified global access to your network, cloud, and applications. Vulnerable Component: BIG-IP ASM, APM,LTM Affected Versions: 16.0.0  15.1.0  14.1.0 - 14.1.2  QID Detection Logic(Authenticated): This QID checks for the vulnerable versions of F5 BIG-IP devices using the tmsh command.
Solution: The vendor has released any patch, for more information please visit: K43310520 Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  K43310520

Title: F5 BIG-IP ASM,LTM,APM HTTP Compression Profile Vulnerability (K26244025)
Consquence: This vulnerability may lead to an out-of-memory condition in the BIG-IP system, causing a denial of service (DoS).
Diagnosis: F5 BIG-IP ASM (Application Security Manager) is a flexible web application firewall that secures web applications in traditional, virtual, and private cloud environments. F5 BIG-IP (LTM) Local Traffic Manager is the most popular module offered on F5 Networks BiG-IP platform. The real power of the LTM is it is a Full Proxy, allowing you to augment client and server side connections. All while making informed load balancing decisions on availability, performance, and persistence. F5 BIG-IP Access Policy Manager (APM) is a secure, flexible, high-performance solution that provides unified global access to your network, cloud, and applications. Vulnerable Component: BIG-IP ASM, APM,LTM Affected Versions: 15.1.0  14.1.0 - 14.1.2  13.1.0 - 13.1.3  12.1.0 - 12.1.5  11.6.1 - 11.6.5  QID Detection Logic(Authenticated): This QID checks for the vulnerable versions of F5 BIG-IP devices using the tmsh command.
Solution: The vendor has released any patch, for more information please visit: K26244025 Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  K26244025

Title: F5 BIG-IP ASM,LTM,APM MQTT iRule Vulnerability (K62830532)
Consquence: The Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) may generate a core file and restart, causing a high availability (HA) failover event.
Diagnosis: F5 BIG-IP ASM (Application Security Manager) is a flexible web application firewall that secures web applications in traditional, virtual, and private cloud environments. F5 BIG-IP (LTM) Local Traffic Manager is the most popular module offered on F5 Networks BiG-IP platform. The real power of the LTM is it is a Full Proxy, allowing you to augment client and server side connections. All while making informed load balancing decisions on availability, performance, and persistence. The issue was addressed with additional state checks. CVE-2020-27925An out-of-bounds write was addressed with improved input validation. CVE-2020-10017An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation. CVE-2020-27909An issue existed within the path validation logic for symlinks. This issue was addressed with improved path sanitization. CVE-2020-10003A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved input validation. CVE-2020-27930An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. CVE-2020-27927A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. CVE-2020-10002An out-of-bounds write was addressed with improved input validation. CVE-2020-27912A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved state management. CVE-2020-27905A memory initialization issue was addressed. CVE-2020-27950A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. CVE-2020-9974A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved state management. CVE-2020-10016A type confusion issue was addressed with improved state handling. CVE-2020-27932An authentication issue was addressed with improved state management. CVE-2020-27902A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. CVE-2020-27917An integer overflow was addressed through improved input validation. CVE-2020-27911A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. CVE-2020-27926A path handling issue was addressed with improved validation. CVE-2020-10010A logic issue was addressed with improved state management. CVE-2020-10004An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation. CVE-2020-13524An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved bounds checking. CVE-2020-10011A use after free issue was addressed with improved memory management. CVE-2020-27918Affected Devices  iPhone 6s and later, iPod touch 7th generation, iPad Air 2 and later, and iPad mini 4 and later

Consquence: This vulnerability could be exploited to gain access to sensitive information also use this vulnerability to change contents or configuration on the system. Additionally this vulnerability can also be used to cause a denial of service in the form of interruptions in resource availability.
Diagnosis: Gentoo Linux is a Linux distribution  A use-after-free in sysstat was discovered which may allow arbitrary code execution. Affected Package: app-admin/sysstat Affected version : Prior to 12.2.1
Solution: The Vendor has released security update to fix the vulnerability.For more information please visit 202007-22 Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  202007-22

Title: XStream Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Consquence: The vulnerability may allow a remote attacker to run arbitrary shell commands only by manipulating the processed input stream.
Diagnosis: XStream is a simple library to serialize objects to XML and back again. The processed stream at unmarshalling time contains type information to recreate the formerly written objects. XStream creates therefore new instances based on these type information. An attacker can manipulate the processed input stream and replace or inject objects, that can execute arbitrary shell commands Affected Versions:XStream library prior to 1.4.14 QID Detection Logic: This authenticated QID fetches the version of XStream library if it is installed via the package manager on Unix based operating systems with commands such as dpkg -l and rpm -qa. NOTE: This QID will work only if the XStream library is installed as via the package manager.
Solution: The vendor has provided fix in version 1.4.14 or above. For more information please visit advisory.Workaround:The vendor has provided workarounds which can be found here. Patch: Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:  CVE-2020-26217
